data.Sentence: --- Lesson 8 The best and the worst

data.Sentence_cn: 乔. 桑德斯拥有我们镇上最漂亮的花园。
data.Sentence: Joe Sanders has the most beautiful garden in our town.

data.Sentence_cn: 几乎每个人都参加每年举办的“最佳花园竞赛”，
data.Sentence: Nearly everybody enters for 'The Nicest Garden Competition' each year,

data.Sentence_cn: 比尔. 弗里斯的花园比乔的花园大，
data.Sentence: Bill Frith's garden is larger than Joe's.

data.Sentence_cn: 他比乔也更为勤奋，种植的花卉和蔬菜也更多，
data.Sentence: Bill works harder than Joe and grows more flowers and vegetables,

data.Sentence_cn: 但乔的花园更富有情趣。
data.Sentence: but Joe's garden is more interesting.

data.Sentence_cn: 他修筑了一条条整洁的小路，并在一个池塘上架了一座小木桥。
data.Sentence: He has made neat paths and has built a wooden bridge over a pool.

data.Sentence_cn: 我也喜欢花园，但我却不愿意辛勤劳动。
data.Sentence: I like gardens too, but I do not like hard work.

data.Sentence_cn: 每年的花园竞赛我也参加，
data.Sentence: Every year I enter for the garden competition too,

data.Sentence_cn: 但总因是镇上最劣的花园而获得一个小奖！
data.Sentence: and I always win a little prize for the worst garden in the town!
